summary: Internal email chain from September 2019 discussing the status of the taint review process for materials seized from Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan residence. The emails show coordination between case agents and legal personnel regarding access to evidence while addressing privilege concerns raised by Epstein's attorneys.

events.title: Materials from Epstein's residence made available
events.description: Materials seized from Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan residence were made available for review.

keyFacts: A taint review was being conducted on materials seized from Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan residence.
The materials were made available for review on September 10, 2019.
Epstein's attorneys were communicating directly with the privilege review coordinator regarding search terms, limiting visibility for others.
The taint review was expected to take additional weeks to complete due to the volume of materials.
Case agents were seeking status updates for a meeting with the ADIC (Assistant Director in Charge).
